name: Crown of Thorns
description: The Corwn of Thorns is a floweing house plant native to Madagascar. The Crown of thorns is known for being 'neglect friendly', or a low maintenance plant perfect for beginners. This plant needs 3 to four hours of full sun every day, and should only be watered after the first two inches of soil are completely dry. Ensure that the growing pot has ample drainage to reduce the likelihood of rot and disease. Be advised, the Crown of Thorns is highly toxic to people and animals when ingested. Take care when handling to avoid skin irritation

name: Desert Rose
description: The Desert Rose plant is a flowering house plant native to East Africa and Arabia. Desert Rose plants are a succulent tropical plant. They require lots of sun and well drained soil. The plant will not produce blooms without plenty of sun. You can tell your Desert Rose is watered suffieiciently by it's swollen trunk which it uses to store water! Desert Rose plants are known to be a bit more sensitive, and are reccomended for moderately experienced plant parents. Be advised, the Desert Rose sap is poisonous and will cause skin irritation

name: Crassula 'Spiralis'
description: The Crassula 'Spiralis' is a rare slow-growing succulent known for it's small, green geometric spiraling leaves. When healthy, it produces small white flowers. Like most succulents, this plant is an accessible choice for inexpereinced plant owners! This succulent needs plenty of sun, very well-draining soil and a pot with plenty of drainage holes. This plant only needs infrequent waterings. Look for soil specifically mixed for succulents, or mix in perlite and sand with regular container soil.

name: String of Pearls
description: The String of Pearls plant is a creeping succulent known for it's trademark growth pattern resembling strings of beads. The String of Pearls will on occasion produce tiny white blooms smelling of cinnamon. String of pearl plants prefer lots of bright indirect sunlight. As a succulent, your String of Pearls will prefer watering only occasionally, well-draining soil, and a well-draining pot. Prune the string of pearls to promote for compact bead growth patterns.

name: Orchid
description: Notoriously picky, orchids require an expereinced care-giver. Orchids prefer to not be over watered but not under-watered, and to have adequate sun to bloom while not too much as to scorch. Orchids need to be fertilized regularly, and require a specific growing medium that is fresh, well-draining, but also water retentive. Orchid mixes or orchid bark are a coommon growing medium used by orchid lovers.

name: Aloe Vera
description: Aloe vera is commonly grown as a houseplant and is noteable for the gel contained in its leaves which is used for making a soothing skin salve (although some people are actually irritated by the gel). Aloe Vera operates like most desert plants, require high light exposure, high temperature climates, and low frequency of weatering with well draining soil. Aloe Vera lovers often place their plants in terra cotta pots as the porous pots absorb the extra moisture after watering

name: Spider Plant
description: Spider plants are known for being very adaptable housplants that thrive in most conditions. The Spider plant, as it's name suggests, produce long sprouting 'legs', or leaves from the base of the plant. The spider plant reproduces with white star-shaped flowers that after sprouting and blooming from shoots will form into small spider plants that hang off the mother plant looking for purchase in the surrounding environment. Most spider plant owners have more than one!

name: Peace Lily
description: Peace Lily's are known for their large glossy leaves, complimented by occassional showy stalks producing a white leaf shaped flower. Peace Lily's tend to be fast-growing and require frequent re-potting to stop from being root-bound. The plant is very responsive,and when it needs water the leaves will droop. This plant does not want direct sunlight and should be placed in a room with limited sun exposure.

name: Fizzle Sizzle
description: Fizzle Sizzles are a uniquely shaped bulb succulent known for their corkscrew curls. The South African Native is small in size, only reaching 8 inches tall at maturity. The Fizzle Sizzle produces seasonal yellow-green blooms with a vanilla fragarance. Fizzle Sizzles should be watered infrequently, and monitored often for signs of over or under watering. The Fizzle Sizzle prefers lots of sun with afternoon shade.

name: Black Bat Flower
description: The Black Bat flower is a novelty plant known for its bloom which resembles a bat. This flower needs a shady location, yearly repotting, well-draining soil that is kept moist but not soggy. A great plant for Halloween!

name: Pencil Cactus
description: The Pencil Cactus is actually not a cactus but a succulent. Pencil Cacti are neglect friendly, only requiring minimal watering and a bright sunny location. Like most succulents it prefers well-draining soil with plenty of drainage holes in the growing pot. Pencil Cacti can grow to be 30 feet tall in the wild, so plant in a room with high cielings! Pencil Cacti do have toxic sap, so handle carefully.

name: Swiss Cheese Monstera
description: Swiss Cheese Monstera plants get their name from their large flat leaves with sporadic holes, thus resembling Swiss cheese. This plant is a fast growing vininig plant perfect for hanging baskets with access to bright indirect light. They prefer moist well drained soil like most tropical plants. Beware, all parts of the plant are toxic.

name: Laceleaf Plant
description: Known for their bright leaf shaped flower, Laceleaf plants thrive in areas with indirect light, and a moderate watering schedule. Consider planting them in a half succulent half container soil potting mix for idea moisture conditions. A great pop of color with lovely green foliage!

name: Chinese Money Plant
description: Also known as a Pancake plant for it's flat circular leaves, the Chinese Money plant is an ideal beginner houseplant. Originally from China, this plant is known for it's ability to be shared between friends. Rumor has it that friends who exchange clippings of this plant will remain friends for life! They prefer bright indirect sunlight and well-draining soil that is allowed to dry out between waterings.

name: Bird of Paradise
description: The Bird of Paradise is a stunning tropical plant known for it's large stunning leaves and huge bloom resembling a colorful bird. This tropical plant prefers a bright environment and moist but never soggy soil. Allow the top 3 inches of soil to dry between waterings. A plant like this needs an attentive owner making it best suited for moderately experienced plant parents.

name: Bromeliad
description: A bright addition to any home or office, the bromeliad is known for it's colorful tropical foliage. Bromeliads prefer shallow pots and growing mediums like orchid mixers. Simply fill the cup at the base of the leaves to water. Keep in bright indirect light locations and watch your tropical friend grow!
